title: How to See How Long You’ve Been on FaceTime

steps.title: Join or start a FaceTime video call.
steps.content: Join or start a FaceTime video call. Select a contact from your Contacts list and click the FaceTime camera icon to begin a call. Your iOS device should already come with the FaceTime app. If you don’t have it, you will need to download FaceTime. FaceTime is available on supported iOS devices such as iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch. [1] X Research source You can also make video calls with supported Mac devices, though the duration will not appear in your Mac’s call history. You will need Wi-Fi or cellular data.

steps.title: Chat as long as you’d like.
steps.content: Chat as long as you’d like. There are plenty of features available to use, such as sharing your screen or hosting a group FaceTime. Be sure to keep your iOS devices updated to enjoy new features and app optimizations!

steps.title: Click End to end the call.
steps.content: Click End to end the call. The button will be red and located at the top right or bottom right corner, depending on your iOS version. [2] X Research source You won’t be able to check the call’s duration until the video call has ended.

steps.title: Navigate to the Recents tab of your Phone app.
steps.content: Navigate to the Recents tab of your Phone app. This will display your call history.

steps.title: Click i to check the call details.
steps.content: Click i to check the call details. This icon will be located to the right of the contact name. After clicking it, the time elapsed can be found underneath the call type. You can also see the date and time the call began.

steps.title: Join or start a FaceTime audio call.
steps.content: Join or start a FaceTime audio call. Choose a contact from your Contacts list and click the FaceTime phone icon to begin a call. Since this call is audio-only, you don’t need to worry about the positioning of the camera. [3] X Research source You have the option to call or receive calls via phone number or Apple ID. If you don’t have access to a reliable internet connection, you can use FaceTime without Wi-Fi .

steps.title: Navigate to the call screen.
steps.content: Navigate to the call screen. This may already be visible to you when you begin the call. [4] X Research source If you don’t see the call screen, click on the green banner at the top or the green button on the top left, depending on your iOS version.

steps.title: Find the keypad and speaker icon.
steps.content: Find the keypad and speaker icon. The elapsed time of your FaceTime audio call will be shown right above. On supported Mac devices, the call duration will be located at the top right corner of the screen as the audio call is active.

steps.title: Alternatively, you can check the elapsed time after the call ends.
steps.content: Alternatively, you can check the elapsed time after the call ends. Navigate to Recents in your phone app. Click the i icon beside the call to check its information. The call duration will be underneath the call type. If you’re using a Mac device, you won’t be able to see the elapsed time in your audio call history once the call ends, so be sure to take note before you hang up!
